LAW 10-10 UBoard of Trustees of the University of the District of Columbia Term Holdover Temporary Amendment Act of 1993 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self- Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. 10-262 on first and second readings, May 4, 1993, and June 1, 1993, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on June 8, 1993, this legislation was assigned Act No. 10-37, published in the June 18, 1993, edition of the D.C. Register Vol. 40 page 3834) and transmitted to Congress on June 10, 1993 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(1) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law 10-10, effective July 31, 1993 ng Chairman the Council Dates Counted During. the 30-day Congressional Review Period: June 10,11,14,15,16,17,18,21,22,23,24,25,28,29,30 July 1,13,14,15,16,19,20,21,22,23,26,27,28,29,30 AN ACT D, C. ACT i0-37 Enrolled Original District Columbia Code Su ptement) IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA JUNE 8, 1993 To amend, on a temporary basis, the District of Columbia Public Postsecondary Education l~eorganization Act to authorize certain trustees of the University of the District of Columbia Board of Trustees to hold over their respective terms until December 7, 1993, or until their successors have been appointed, whichever comes first. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Board of Trustees of the University of the District of Columbia Term Holdover Temporary Amendment Act of 1993 Sec. 2. Section 201 of the District of Columbia Public Postsecondary Education l~eorganization Act, approved October 26, 1974 (88 Star. 1424; D.C. Code § 31-1511 is amended as follows a) Subsection (h D.C. Code § 31-1511(h is repealed b) A new subsection (o) is added to read as follows o) Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no later than June 30, 1993, the University of the District of Columbia Board of Trustees Nominating Committee shall transmit to the Mayor, a list containing 3 times as many prospective nominees as there are vacancies arising from the expiration of Trustee terms on May 15, 1993, and vacancies because of death, resignation, or removal for cause. No later than September 16, 1993, the Mayor shall transmit to the Council nominees to the Board of Trustees. The Council shall act on each timely nomination not later than December 7, 1993, and if no action is taken by the Council on or before December 7, 1993, the nomination shall be deemed approved Note, Section 31-1511 Sec. 3 a) This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, override of the veto by the Council as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Star. 813; D.C. Code §1-233(c)(1 and publication in either the District of Columbia l~egister, the District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large, or the District of Columbia Municipal Regulations b) This act shall expire on the 225th day of its having taken effect or upon the effective date of the Board of Trustees of the University of Enrolled Original the District of Columbia Term Holdover Amendment Act of 1993, whichever occurs first ait~a~istrict of Columbia APPI{)VED: June 8, 1993 COL~’CIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLL~4B[A COUNCIL PERIOD TEN RECORD OF OFFICIAL COUNCIL VOTE DOCKET NO: B10-262 [] Item on Consent Calendar ACTION & DATE VOICE VOTE: Adopted First Reading, 5-4-93 Approved Recorded vote on request Absent: all present [] ROLL CALL VOTE RESULT COUNCIL MEMBER CHMN.
